string.text: Regarding your assignment…
Oh, I’m listening. Any luck in finding that notebook?

Yes. I found the notebook. In it were the coordinates of some meeting. I found a note where the meeting was supposed to take place, which led me to the old tunnel. Most importantly, I had to wait until night, which is when the meeting was supposed to take place. And so it did: I met a bandit who wanted twenty-five thousand from me. I had to drop him.
That’s very strange. We should check out the case right away. There might be some very useful information inside…
All right. I’ll take care of the case… and I suggest you take care of the money that you owe me now.

It can’t be. There’s a stalker base nearby. The bandits from the northern outpost know these parts well, so they would have known better than to go through there. It wasn’t someone local; I can tell you that. And what did he offer you for the money?
It was likely supposed to be payment for the case that he had.
Do you have it? We should check what’s inside.
I have the case, but the lock’s too strong. I can’t get it to open at all, and it weighs almost nothing. I doubt there’s anything useful inside.
That’s very strange. We should take a look at the case right away. There might be some very useful information inside…
All right. I’ll take care of the case. Just remember that, whatever’s inside, I won’t be giving it to you for free.
Yes. I found the notebook and paid twenty-five thousand for it. Now I expect thirty thousand back from you. Any questions?
Shit… How come? What happened? Can you put it briefly?
Not much I can say. I met a bandit in the tunnel who took away twenty-five grand from me, as per your request.

It can’t be. There’s a stalker base nearby. The bandits from the northern outpost know these parts well, so they would have known better than to go through there. It wasn’t someone local; I can tell you that. And what did he want for the money? And how did you end up there in the first place?

I found a notebook at the site of the firefight. In it were the coordinates of some meeting. I found a note where the meeting was supposed to take place, which led me to the old tunnel. It was a trap, and I was forced to pay twenty-five thousand for some case.
We need to see what’s inside the case. Do you have it?
I have the case, but the lock’s too strong. I can’t get it to open at all, and it weighs almost nothing. I doubt there’s anything useful inside.
Oh, I’m listening. Any luck in finding that notebook?
Any luck with the case? Is it open?
Ha. Got it to open after all. It was a very tough nut to crack. What I found in the case was a flash drive and a folder with documents of some kind. I haven’t touched any of it, so don’t worry.
Thanks, Van. What do I owe you?
It was a lot of work, so it’ll be two thousand. Then you can have your stuff.
All right. Here’s your money.
I don’t have that much money on me…
Then I don’t have any flash drive or folder for you. Come visit me when you have the funds.
Fantastic! The case and its contents are now yours.
Regarding the case…
Ready to pay for having it opened?
Yes. Here’s the money.
Not yet.
Fantastic! The case and its contents are now yours.
Then come visit me when you have the funds.
Listen, Van, I have a case that needs opening. Can you take a look?

Show me what you’ve got…\n \nWell, this is some strong protection. Whoever had this case certainly didn’t want it to fall into the wrong hands. All right… I can’t promise anything, but I’ll do my best to help you out. Leave the case here. After I’m done, I’ll get in touch with you.
Thank you! Take the case.
As I said, I can’t promise anything. Bypassing a lock like this won’t be easy.
Sidorovich, I have something for you.
Well, don’t be shy. Show me what you’ve got.
A very interesting folder of documents and a flash drive from a case, as well as an old notebook and a note from a bandit. I think the information here will interest you.
Give me more details. Where is this case from?

I got a hold of the case through a strange series of events. Too long to explain. It was given to me by a bandit by the name of Skull. The documents contain information about collaboration between the bandits and the military. Will you take it?
Well, it’s clear that the information is valuable. Frankly, I don’t care where you got it, but it’s good that you brought it here. Have this; you deserve it.
The case is open. There was only a flash drive and a document folder inside. Here. Have a look.

All right. Let’s take a look…
 
Uh-huh… The flash drive contains a partial recorded conversation involving Borov and some other anonymous fellow. This is interesting. Let’s see what the documents hold…
 
Oh, wow… The picture’s getting clearer. It seems our faceless man is from the military… What you’ve discovered here, Beast, is quite literally worth its weight in gold. I don’t think Borov and his henchmen are gonna be too happy about this leak. And I think I know what to do with all of this.
 
I’ll give you thirty grand for the docs and the flash drive. If you’re selling that notebook with the note, I’ll give you an additional three grand. I hope it’ll cover all of your expenses. So, we got a deal?
Then I’ll wait for my money. See you later!
Take it and give it to someone else. I have no use for it, and I have enough things on my plate.
There’s just one other thing: after the events at the railroad embankment, I’ve gone short of money. Because of that, you’ll have to wait a day or two. I’ll return everything; I’ll return even more.

All right. There’s no rush. But still, don’t take *too* long. Strange things happen to those in debt; they die for various reasons. Do you understand? And let the case stay here. It’ll be safer that way.

No. For the second time, I’m not buying that. You will return the case without receiving the flash drive or the documents while remaining in debt. If I were in your shoes, I’d pay it as soon as possible. The Zone doesn’t favor those in debt, and neither do I. So, until I see my money, you better not cross paths with any mercenaries.
Yes. I’ll pay you back everything.
Then I’ll wait for my money. See you later!

No. For the second time, I’m not buying that. You will return the case without receiving the flash drive or the documents while remaining in debt for my services. If I were in your shoes, I’d pay it as soon as possible. The Zone doesn’t favor those in debt, and neither do I. So, until I see my money, you better not cross paths with any mercenaries.
Yes. I’ll pay you back everything.
Stop, merc! Don’t shoot! I give up!
Calm down. I wasn’t planning on shooting. You should tell me how you got here.
I came from the Garbage to deliver some goods to Sidorovich. I decided to stop and catch my breath. I went under the bridge, by the fire, to tie my shoes, and then you showed up out of nowhere.
All right. Calm down. You can continue on your way. I’ll be going.
Phew. You had me confused there. I think I’ll have a break and sit here a bit longer.
Yeah. Bye.
Shilov, I hope you haven’t sent the stalkers to the anomaly yet?…
No. I was just getting ready to tell the people about the “Hidden Path.”
Forget it. Don’t do it. It’s a trap.
Well, spill the beans and tell me what happened.

You remember that corpse I told you about that I saw on the way here? So, after I talked to you, I had a sudden tingling feeling in my head, and even heard a voice. It was calling me. I don’t know how, but I knew where to go. Later on, it was clear to me that a controller was behind this, the fucking thing. Tell me: have you ever seen a controller in the Cordon? Neither have I; they don’t usually come around these parts.\n \nI think this has to do with the anomaly. I don’t know if I should share this, but I have a theory: what if someone who’s gone into the anomaly teleports into a predetermined anomalous area, and, at the same time, not far away from that very anomaly, some kind of beast appears? I don’t know exactly how the anomaly summons mutants, but there’s something very strange going on.

If someone else was telling me this, I would’ve just told them to sober up. You, though… I can trust you, and if you say that anomaly is dangerous, then so be it. Although, I’m still gonna tell the scientists about it, and share your theory. I’ll share the pay with you. In the meantime, how about we share a bottle of my best vodka? I’ve been keeping it for a rainy day.
Sure. A drink won’t hurt. Bye!
Orest told me you had some work that needs doing.
Heh… Yeah. I’ve got some work, but how much will your services set me back, merc?
As you know, merc… That’s your business.
Don’t come to me with these types of assignments in the future. Good day.
That depends on what kind of work you’re offering me.
Fine. We’ll deal with that later. You’ve probably noticed by now that there’s an anomaly above the railroad embankment? A “Big Bubble,” it seems. That’s what the stalkers here call it.
Let’s say I’ve noticed it.

Well, I have a theory that I want to put into practice. I was listening when Scar, one of your men, told me about an anomaly that he encountered in the Red Forest. It’s called the “witch circle.” From his description, it resembles the one that’s “hanging” with us above the railroad embankment. According to what he said, it’s something like a teleporter: if you walk into the anomaly, it’s supposed to take you to another place. As it turns out, I need a volunteer to check whether it’s all true.
Why haven’t you sent any of the stalkers there until now?

Truthfully, the local stalkers are rather afraid of even getting close to the anomaly. They use the tunnel under the embankment to get to Sidorovich. It’s not hard to understand where they’re coming from; this place has been full of unsettling rumors for a long time. Even though it’s all a load of crap, it scares the youngsters. I want to find out where that teleporter leads. I guarantee you that there will be no harm in going into it. I’d go there myself, but I can’t abandon my trading post. Will you go?
I’ll go check this “Big Bubble.” Wait here, and I’ll be back with some answers.
No, thanks. I value my own life.
I just came out of the anomaly.
You actually went into it?! Tell me everything you saw. Is it really a witch’s circle?
Slow down a minute. You were right: the anomaly definitely works as a teleporter. It brought me to the tunnel outside the rookie village…
Hot damn! My theory proved true. Now, the stalkers will have an easier time getting to the village…

Hold on. I’ve had a strange feeling of some kind ever since I got out of the anomaly. I… can’t really put my finger on it. I met a stalker in the tunnel and spoke to him. He was alive, but when I was going back to you, I saw his dead body not far away from the farm. Doesn’t that seem a little strange to you?

This is the Zone, my friend. Somebody’s always dying here, and the circumstances are almost always mysterious. Have your reward; take a drink; loosen up. You helped me, and I appreciate it. I think the scientists at Yantar will be interested in hearing about this.
You work for the scientists?

Sometimes; not always. In return, they give me ammo from their warehouses. Freaking eggheads… They have no idea how to shoot a gun in the first place, and yet, the government sends them crates full of ammunition. If only we had firepower like that… Anyway, I won’t waste any more of your time.
All right. I’ll go. Good luck!
I assume you’ve gathered my money?

Yeah. I even went to my own hideout; I kept a stash there for an emergency. So I decided to give up my loot and use all of the money I saved for this. I’m sure everything will pay off soon. Do you have the documents and the flash drive?
Yeah. Here they are. Take it.
Have this. You earned it. And thank you again.
What do you want?
Well, I retrieved my loot from my hideout and sold it to Sidorovich. So now I’m ready to pay you my debt. I don’t want any bad blood with the mercs.
Oh, now we’re talking.
I want to ask you about something.
Speak up. You know not to keep me waiting.
I found a case not long ago. I want to know what’s inside, but it’s locked. It’s a tough lock, too, so there’s no chance in breaking it open.
There’s a guy in the village. Goes by Van. Go talk to him; he helped me with a similar problem.
I want to ask you about something.
Ask, and I’ll do my best to answer.
I found a case not long ago. I want to know what’s inside, but it’s locked. It’s a tough lock, too, so there’s no chance in breaking it open.
Hmm… Let me think. I don’t know. Go see Van; he might be able to help.
Stop right there! Drop your guns! Hands on your head!
Calm down. I’m with the guys from the checkpoint. I found your note by the overturned wagon.
Got the dough?
Remind me, how much is it?
You don’t get it? Trying to cheat me? Give me twenty-five grand, or I’ll bust a cap in your ass.
Slow down. Here’s your cash.
’Kay. Seems like you have everything. Take the case and forget everything that just happened. Got it?
Hold on! What kind of case is this?
Mmm… I don’t have the money.
You wanted something?
Yes, Beast. There’s something I need to talk to you about. But first, promise me that you won’t tell anyone about this. Okay?
All right. Won’t tell anyone. What’s the matter?

We ran into a few bandits by accident. Usually, they don’t go beyond the overturned Zaporozhets car… My point is: they were looking for something, and we just stumbled upon them on the road. Their behavior was also really strange. I saw one of them drop an old notebook during a firefight, and then I saw a gunshot… After that, my vision went black, and when I woke up, I saw you. I also saw them take captives and leave the area. You understand? Wherever I went, I couldn’t find them.
Okay. And what do you suggest we do?
Can you go there, where you found me, and take a second look? Maybe you can find something. I have a gut feeling that those bandits were there for a reason. Don’t worry: I’ll pay up. You know me.
All right. I’ll see what I can find.
I have better things to do than waste my time looking for something only God knows about.
